hits.product: CpxA is a membrane-localized sensor kinase that is activated by envelope stress. It starts a kinase cascade that activates CpxR which promotes efflux complex expression.
fosA6 is a plasmid-encoded enzyme that confers resistance to fosfomycin in Escherichia coli by breaking the epoxide ring of the molecule.

Protein subunit of AcrA-AcrB-TolC multidrug efflux complex. AcrB functions as a herterotrimer which forms the inner membrane component and is primarily responsible for substrate recognition and energy transduction by acting as a drug/proton antiporter.
AcrA is a subunit of the AcrAB multidrug efflux system that in K. pneumoniae which is encoded by the acrRAB operon.

RamA (resistance antibiotic multiple) is a positive regulator of AcrAB-TolC and leads to high level multidrug resistance in Klebsiella pneumoniae Salmonella enterica and Enterobacter aerugenes increasing the expression of both the mar operon as well as AcrAB. RamA also decreases OmpF expression.

MsbA is a multidrug resistance transporter homolog from E. coli and belongs to a superfamily of transporters that contain an adenosine triphosphate (ATP) binding cassette (ABC) which is also called a nucleotide-binding domain (NBD). MsbA is a member of the MDR-ABC transporter group by sequence homology. MsbA transports lipid A a major component of the bacterial outer cell membrane and is the only bacterial ABC transporter that is essential for cell viability.

Klebsiella pneumoniae outer membrane porin protein. Is preferentially detected in porin-deficient strains. Functional characterization of this new porin revealed a narrower pore than those of porins OmpK35 and OmpK36 which did not allow penetration by certain beta-lactams. Also when a resistant strain expresses porin OmpK37 is less susceptible to cefotaxime and cefoxitin than when it is expressing either OmpK36 or OmpK35.

KpnE subunit of KpnEF resembles EbrAB from E. coli. Mutation in KpnEF resulted in increased susceptibility to cefepime ceftriaxon colistin erythromycin rifampin tetracycline and streptomycin as well as enhanced sensitivity toward sodium dodecyl sulfate deoxycholate dyes benzalkonium chloride chlorhexidine and triclosan

KpnF subunit of KpnEF resembles EbrAB from E. coli. Mutation in KpnEF resulted in increased susceptibility to cefepime ceftriaxon colistin erythromycin rifampin tetracycline and streptomycin as well as enhanced sensitivity toward sodium dodecyl sulfate deoxycholate dyes benzalkonium chloride chlorhexidine and triclosan.
From the Lahey list of beta-lactamases.
In the presence of antibiotic stress E. coli overexpresses the global activator protein MarA which besides inducing MDR efflux pump AcrAB also down- regulates synthesis of the porin OmpF.

H-NS is a histone-like protein involved in global gene regulation in Gram-negative bacteria. It is a repressor of the membrane fusion protein genes acrE mdtE and emrK as well as nearby genes of many RND-type multidrug exporters.
MdtB is a transporter that forms a heteromultimer complex with MdtC to form a multidrug transporter. MdtBC is part of the MdtABC-TolC efflux complex.

MdtC is a transporter that forms a heteromultimer complex with MdtB to form a multidrug transporter. MdtBC is part of the MdtABC-TolC efflux complex. In the absence of MdtB MdtC can form a homomultimer complex that results in a functioning efflux complex with a narrower drug specificity. mdtC corresponds to 3 loci in Pseudomonas aeruginosa PAO1 (gene name: muxC/muxB) and 3 loci in Pseudomonas aeruginosa LESB58.
BaeR is a response regulator that promotes the expression of MdtABC and AcrD efflux complexes.
AcrD is an aminoglycoside efflux pump expressed in E. coli. Its expression can be induced by indole and is regulated by baeRS and cpxAR.
EmrR is a negative regulator for the EmrAB-TolC multidrug efflux pump in E. coli. Mutations lead to EmrAB-TolC overexpression.

KpnG consists of ~390 residues and resembles EmrA of E. coli. Disruption of the pump components KpnG-KpnH signficantly decrease resistance to azithromycin ceftazidime ciprofloxacin ertapenem erythromycin gentamicin imipenem ticarcillin norfloxacin polymyxin-B piperacillin spectinomycin tobramycin and streptomycin

KpnH consists of ~511 residues resembles EmrB of E. coli and is probably a translocase in the KpnGH-TolC efflux protein in K. pneumoniae. Disruption of the pump components KpnG-KpnH signficantly decrease resistance to azithromycin ceftazidime ciprofloxacin ertapenem erythromycin gentamicin imipenem ticarcillin norfloxacin polymyxin-B piperacillin spectinomycin tobramycin and streptomycin.
CRP is a global regulator that represses MdtEF multidrug efflux pump expression.

KPC-2 is a beta-lactamase found in Klebsiella pneumoniae and Pseudomonas aeruginosa.
TEM-1 is a broad-spectrum beta-lactamase found in many Gram-negative bacteria. Confers resistance to penicillins and first generation cephalosphorins.

RmtB is a 16S rRNA methyltransferase that targets mature or nearly mature 30S subunits. It transfers a methyl group from S-adenosyl-L-methionine to N7-G1405 of the 16S rRNA an aminoglycoside binding site.

TetG is a tetracycline efflux protein found in Gram-negative bacteria. The encoding gene is found in both chromosomal and plasmid DNA where it is frequently linked to the floR sul1 and cmlA9 genes which encode proteins that can confer florfenicol/chloramphenicol sulfamethoxazole and chloramphenicol resistance respectively.

A novel bleomycin resistance protein encoded by a metallo-beta-lactamase-associated ble gene. Expression of BRP(MBL) confers resistance to bleomycin and bleomycin-like antibiotics in Enterobacteriaceae and Acinetobacter where it is co-expressed with an MBL and controlled by the same promoter region.

In the absence of MdtB MdtC can form a homomultimer complex that results in a functioning efflux complex with a narrower drug specificity. mdtC corresponds to 3 loci in Pseudomonas aeruginosa PAO1 (gene name: muxC/muxB) and 3 loci in Pseudomonas aeruginosa LESB58.
BaeR is a response regulator that promotes the expression of MdtABC and AcrD efflux complexes.
AcrD is an aminoglycoside efflux pump expressed in E. coli. Its expression can be induced by indole and is regulated by baeRS and cpxAR.
In the presence of antibiotic stress E. coli overexpresses the global activator protein MarA which besides inducing MDR efflux pump AcrAB also down- regulates synthesis of the porin OmpF.

RamA (resistance antibiotic multiple) is a positive regulator of AcrAB-TolC and leads to high level multidrug resistance in Klebsiella pneumoniae Salmonella enterica and Enterobacter aerugenes increasing the expression of both the mar operon as well as AcrAB. RamA also decreases OmpF expression.
CpxA is a membrane-localized sensor kinase that is activated by envelope stress. It starts a kinase cascade that activates CpxR which promotes efflux complex expression.

H-NS is a histone-like protein involved in global gene regulation in Gram-negative bacteria. It is a repressor of the membrane fusion protein genes acrE mdtE and emrK as well as nearby genes of many RND-type multidrug exporters.
AcrA is a subunit of the AcrAB multidrug efflux system that in K. pneumoniae which is encoded by the acrRAB operon.

Protein subunit of AcrA-AcrB-TolC multidrug efflux complex. AcrB functions as a herterotrimer which forms the inner membrane component and is primarily responsible for substrate recognition and energy transduction by acting as a drug/proton antiporter.
KPC-2 is a beta-lactamase found in Klebsiella pneumoniae and Pseudomonas aeruginosa.

MsbA is a multidrug resistance transporter homolog from E. coli and belongs to a superfamily of transporters that contain an adenosine triphosphate (ATP) binding cassette (ABC) which is also called a nucleotide-binding domain (NBD). MsbA is a member of the MDR-ABC transporter group by sequence homology. MsbA transports lipid A a major component of the bacterial outer cell membrane and is the only bacterial ABC transporter that is essential for cell viability.
VEB-1 is a beta-lactamase found in Escherichia coli and Pseudomonas aeruginosa.

Plasmid or integron-encoded nucleotidylylation of 2-deoxystreptamine aminoglycosides at the hydroxyl group at position 2'' in P. aeruginosa K. pneumoniae Morganella morganii E. coli S. typhimurium C. freundii and A. baumannii
arr-2 is an integron-encoded ribosyltransferase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa
cmlA5 is a plasmid or transposon-encoded chloramphenicol exporter that is found in Escherichia coli
OXA-10 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter baumannii and P. aeruginosa.
ANT(3'')-IIa is a aminoglycoside nucleotidyltransferase identified in Acinetobacter spp. via horizontal gene transfer mechanisms.

floR is a plasmid or chromosome-encoded chloramphenicol exporter that is found in Bordetella bronchiseptica Escherichia coli Klebsiella pneumoniae Salmonella enterica subsp. enterica serovar Typhimurium str. DT104 and Vibrio cholerae

TetG is a tetracycline efflux protein found in Gram-negative bacteria. The encoding gene is found in both chromosomal and plasmid DNA where it is frequently linked to the floR sul1 and cmlA9 genes which encode proteins that can confer florfenicol/chloramphenicol sulfamethoxazole and chloramphenicol resistance respectively.

RmtB is a 16S rRNA methyltransferase that targets mature or nearly mature 30S subunits. It transfers a methyl group from S-adenosyl-L-methionine to N7-G1405 of the 16S rRNA an aminoglycoside binding site.
dfrA23 is an integron-encoded dihydrofolate reductase found in Salmonella enterica

The mphA gene encodes for resistance enzyme MPH(2')-I which preferentially inactivate 14-membered macrolides (e.g.erythromycin telithromycin roxithromycin) over 16-membered macrolides (e.g.tylosin spiramycin). It phosphorylates macrolides at 2'-OH hydroxyl of desosamine sugar of macrolides in a GTP-dependent manner.
fosA6 is a plasmid-encoded enzyme that confers resistance to fosfomycin in Escherichia coli by breaking the epoxide ring of the molecule.

APH(3')-Ia is a transposon-encoded aminoglycoside phosphotransferase in E. coli and S. enterica. AAC(6')-Ib10 is an integron-encoded aminoglycoside acetyltransferase in P. aeruginosa

Klebsiella pneumoniae outer membrane porin protein. Is preferentially detected in porin-deficient strains. Functional characterization of this new porin revealed a narrower pore than those of porins OmpK35 and OmpK36 which did not allow penetration by certain beta-lactams. Also when a resistant strain expresses porin OmpK37 is less susceptible to cefotaxime and cefoxitin than when it is expressing either OmpK36 or OmpK35.

Mutation in KpnEF resulted in increased susceptibility to cefepime ceftriaxon colistin erythromycin rifampin tetracycline and streptomycin as well as enhanced sensitivity toward sodium dodecyl sulfate deoxycholate dyes benzalkonium chloride chlorhexidine and triclosan.

KpnE subunit of KpnEF resembles EbrAB from E. coli. Mutation in KpnEF resulted in increased susceptibility to cefepime ceftriaxon colistin erythromycin rifampin tetracycline and streptomycin as well as enhanced sensitivity toward sodium dodecyl sulfate deoxycholate dyes benzalkonium chloride chlorhexidine and triclosan

Klebsiella pneumoniae outer membrane porin protein. Is preferentially detected in porin-deficient strains. Functional characterization of this new porin revealed a narrower pore than those of porins OmpK35 and OmpK36 which did not allow penetration by certain beta-lactams. Also when a resistant strain expresses porin OmpK37 is less susceptible to cefotaxime and cefoxitin than when it is expressing either OmpK36 or OmpK35.
AAC(6')-Ib10 is an integron-encoded aminoglycoside acetyltransferase in P. aeruginosa
OXA-9 is a beta-lactamase found in Klebsiella pneumoniae.

H-NS is a histone-like protein involved in global gene regulation in Gram-negative bacteria. It is a repressor of the membrane fusion protein genes acrE mdtE and emrK as well as nearby genes of many RND-type multidrug exporters.
CRP is a global regulator that represses MdtEF multidrug efflux pump expression.

APH(3')-Ia is a transposon-encoded aminoglycoside phosphotransferase in E. coli and S. enterica. It is identical at the protein sequence to APH(3')-Ic an aminoglycoside phosphotransferase encoded by plasmids transposons and genomic islands in K. pneumoniae A. baumannii S. marcescens Corynebacterium spp. Photobacterium spp. and Citrobacter spp.

MsbA is a multidrug resistance transporter homolog from E. coli and belongs to a superfamily of transporters that contain an adenosine triphosphate (ATP) binding cassette (ABC) which is also called a nucleotide-binding domain (NBD). MsbA is a member of the MDR-ABC transporter group by sequence homology. MsbA transports lipid A a major component of the bacterial outer cell membrane and is the only bacterial ABC transporter that is essential for cell viability.

EmrR is a negative regulator for the EmrAB-TolC multidrug efflux pump in E. coli. Mutations lead to EmrAB-TolC overexpression.

KpnG consists of ~390 residues and resembles EmrA of E. coli. Disruption of the pump components KpnG-KpnH signficantly decrease resistance to azithromycin ceftazidime ciprofloxacin ertapenem erythromycin gentamicin imipenem ticarcillin norfloxacin polymyxin-B piperacillin spectinomycin tobramycin and streptomycin

KpnH consists of ~511 residues resembles EmrB of E. coli and is probably a translocase in the KpnGH-TolC efflux protein in K. pneumoniae. Disruption of the pump components KpnG-KpnH signficantly decrease resistance to azithromycin ceftazidime ciprofloxacin ertapenem erythromycin gentamicin imipenem ticarcillin norfloxacin polymyxin-B piperacillin spectinomycin tobramycin and streptomycin.

Protein subunit of AcrA-AcrB-TolC multidrug efflux complex. AcrB functions as a herterotrimer which forms the inner membrane component and is primarily responsible for substrate recognition and energy transduction by acting as a drug/proton antiporter.
AcrA is a subunit of the AcrAB multidrug efflux system that in K. pneumoniae which is encoded by the acrRAB operon.

RamA (resistance antibiotic multiple) is a positive regulator of AcrAB-TolC and leads to high level multidrug resistance in Klebsiella pneumoniae Salmonella enterica and Enterobacter aerugenes increasing the expression of both the mar operon as well as AcrAB. RamA also decreases OmpF expression.

MsbA is a multidrug resistance transporter homolog from E. coli and belongs to a superfamily of transporters that contain an adenosine triphosphate (ATP) binding cassette (ABC) which is also called a nucleotide-binding domain (NBD). MsbA is a member of the MDR-ABC transporter group by sequence homology. MsbA transports lipid A a major component of the bacterial outer cell membrane and is the only bacterial ABC transporter that is essential for cell viability.
In the presence of antibiotic stress E. coli overexpresses the global activator protein MarA which besides inducing MDR efflux pump AcrAB also down- regulates synthesis of the porin OmpF.
CpxA is a membrane-localized sensor kinase that is activated by envelope stress. It starts a kinase cascade that activates CpxR which promotes efflux complex expression.
MdtB is a transporter that forms a heteromultimer complex with MdtC to form a multidrug transporter. MdtBC is part of the MdtABC-TolC efflux complex.

MdtC is a transporter that forms a heteromultimer complex with MdtB to form a multidrug transporter. MdtBC is part of the MdtABC-TolC efflux complex. In the absence of MdtB MdtC can form a homomultimer complex that results in a functioning efflux complex with a narrower drug specificity. mdtC corresponds to 3 loci in Pseudomonas aeruginosa PAO1 (gene name: muxC/muxB) and 3 loci in Pseudomonas aeruginosa LESB58.
BaeR is a response regulator that promotes the expression of MdtABC and AcrD efflux complexes.
AcrD is an aminoglycoside efflux pump expressed in E. coli. Its expression can be induced by indole and is regulated by baeRS and cpxAR.
catI is a chromosome and transposon-encoded variant of the cat gene found in Escherichia coli and Acinetobacter baumannii
dfrA12 is an integron-encoded dihydrofolate reductase found in Vibrio cholerae
aadA2 is an aminoglycoside nucleotidyltransferase gene encoded by plasmids and integrons in K. pneumoniae Salmonella spp. Corynebacterium glutamicum C. freundii and Aeromonas spp.
Sul1 is a sulfonamide resistant dihydropteroate synthase of Gram-negative bacteria. It is linked to other resistance genes of class 1 integrons.

The mphA gene encodes for resistance enzyme MPH(2')-I which preferentially inactivate 14-membered macrolides (e.g.erythromycin telithromycin roxithromycin) over 16-membered macrolides (e.g.tylosin spiramycin). It phosphorylates macrolides at 2'-OH hydroxyl of desosamine sugar of macrolides in a GTP-dependent manner.

Klebsiella pneumoniae outer membrane porin protein. Is preferentially detected in porin-deficient strains. Functional characterization of this new porin revealed a narrower pore than those of porins OmpK35 and OmpK36 which did not allow penetration by certain beta-lactams. Also when a resistant strain expresses porin OmpK37 is less susceptible to cefotaxime and cefoxitin than when it is expressing either OmpK36 or OmpK35.
From the Lahey list of beta-lactamases.
In the presence of antibiotic stress E. coli overexpresses the global activator protein MarA which besides inducing MDR efflux pump AcrAB also down- regulates synthesis of the porin OmpF.
Sul2 is a sulfonamide resistant dihydropteroate synthase of Gram-negative bacteria usually found on small plasmids.
APH(3'')-Ib is an aminoglycoside phosphotransferase encoded by plasmids transposons integrative conjugative elements and chromosomes in Enterobacteriaceae and Pseudomonas spp.

APH(6)-Id is an aminoglycoside phosphotransferase encoded by plasmids integrative conjugative elements and chromosomal genomic islands in K. pneumoniae Salmonella spp. E. coli Shigella flexneri Providencia alcalifaciens Pseudomonas spp. V. cholerae Edwardsiella tarda Pasteurella multocida and Aeromonas bestiarum
TetA is a tetracycline efflux pump found in many species of Gram-negative bacteria.
CpxA is a membrane-localized sensor kinase that is activated by envelope stress. It starts a kinase cascade that activates CpxR which promotes efflux complex expression.
BaeR is a response regulator that promotes the expression of MdtABC and AcrD efflux complexes.

MdtC is a transporter that forms a heteromultimer complex with MdtB to form a multidrug transporter. MdtBC is part of the MdtABC-TolC efflux complex. In the absence of MdtB MdtC can form a homomultimer complex that results in a functioning efflux complex with a narrower drug specificity. mdtC corresponds to 3 loci in Pseudomonas aeruginosa PAO1 (gene name: muxC/muxB) and 3 loci in Pseudomonas aeruginosa LESB58.
MdtB is a transporter that forms a heteromultimer complex with MdtC to form a multidrug transporter. MdtBC is part of the MdtABC-TolC efflux complex.

KpnH consists of ~511 residues resembles EmrB of E. coli and is probably a translocase in the KpnGH-TolC efflux protein in K. pneumoniae. Disruption of the pump components KpnG-KpnH signficantly decrease resistance to azithromycin ceftazidime ciprofloxacin ertapenem erythromycin gentamicin imipenem ticarcillin norfloxacin polymyxin-B piperacillin spectinomycin tobramycin and streptomycin.

KpnG consists of ~390 residues and resembles EmrA of E. coli. Disruption of the pump components KpnG-KpnH signficantly decrease resistance to azithromycin ceftazidime ciprofloxacin ertapenem erythromycin gentamicin imipenem ticarcillin norfloxacin polymyxin-B piperacillin spectinomycin tobramycin and streptomycin
EmrR is a negative regulator for the EmrAB-TolC multidrug efflux pump in E. coli. Mutations lead to EmrAB-TolC overexpression.
AcrD is an aminoglycoside efflux pump expressed in E. coli. Its expression can be induced by indole and is regulated by baeRS and cpxAR.

MsbA is a multidrug resistance transporter homolog from E. coli and belongs to a superfamily of transporters that contain an adenosine triphosphate (ATP) binding cassette (ABC) which is also called a nucleotide-binding domain (NBD). MsbA is a member of the MDR-ABC transporter group by sequence homology. MsbA transports lipid A a major component of the bacterial outer cell membrane and is the only bacterial ABC transporter that is essential for cell viability.

KpnE subunit of KpnEF resembles EbrAB from E. coli. Mutation in KpnEF resulted in increased susceptibility to cefepime ceftriaxon colistin erythromycin rifampin tetracycline and streptomycin as well as enhanced sensitivity toward sodium dodecyl sulfate deoxycholate dyes benzalkonium chloride chlorhexidine and triclosan

Protein subunit of AcrA-AcrB-TolC multidrug efflux complex. AcrB functions as a herterotrimer which forms the inner membrane component and is primarily responsible for substrate recognition and energy transduction by acting as a drug/proton antiporter.

TEM-1 is a broad-spectrum beta-lactamase found in many Gram-negative bacteria. Confers resistance to penicillins and first generation cephalosphorins.

RmtB is a 16S rRNA methyltransferase that targets mature or nearly mature 30S subunits. It transfers a methyl group from S-adenosyl-L-methionine to N7-G1405 of the 16S rRNA an aminoglycoside binding site.

TetG is a tetracycline efflux protein found in Gram-negative bacteria. The encoding gene is found in both chromosomal and plasmid DNA where it is frequently linked to the floR sul1 and cmlA9 genes which encode proteins that can confer florfenicol/chloramphenicol sulfamethoxazole and chloramphenicol resistance respectively.

TetA is a tetracycline efflux pump found in many species of Gram-negative bacteria.

Protein subunit of AcrA-AcrB-TolC multidrug efflux complex. AcrB functions as a herterotrimer which forms the inner membrane component and is primarily responsible for substrate recognition and energy transduction by acting as a drug/proton antiporter.
AcrA is a subunit of the AcrAB multidrug efflux system that in K. pneumoniae which is encoded by the acrRAB operon.

RamA (resistance antibiotic multiple) is a positive regulator of AcrAB-TolC and leads to high level multidrug resistance in Klebsiella pneumoniae Salmonella enterica and Enterobacter aerugenes increasing the expression of both the mar operon as well as AcrAB. RamA also decreases OmpF expression.

MsbA is a multidrug resistance transporter homolog from E. coli and belongs to a superfamily of transporters that contain an adenosine triphosphate (ATP) binding cassette (ABC) which is also called a nucleotide-binding domain (NBD). MsbA is a member of the MDR-ABC transporter group by sequence homology. MsbA transports lipid A a major component of the bacterial outer cell membrane and is the only bacterial ABC transporter that is essential for cell viability.
OXA-9 is a beta-lactamase found in Klebsiella pneumoniae.
AAC(6')-Ib10 is an integron-encoded aminoglycoside acetyltransferase in P. aeruginosa

APH(3')-Ia is a transposon-encoded aminoglycoside phosphotransferase in E. coli and S. enterica. It is identical at the protein sequence to APH(3')-Ic an aminoglycoside phosphotransferase encoded by plasmids transposons and genomic islands in K. pneumoniae A. baumannii S. marcescens Corynebacterium spp. Photobacterium spp. and Citrobacter spp.
fosA6 is a plasmid-encoded enzyme that confers resistance to fosfomycin in Escherichia coli by breaking the epoxide ring of the molecule.
TEM-104 is a beta-lactamase found in Klebsiella pneumoniae.
From the Lahey list of beta-lactamases.

Klebsiella pneumoniae outer membrane porin protein. Is preferentially detected in porin-deficient strains. Functional characterization of this new porin revealed a narrower pore than those of porins OmpK35 and OmpK36 which did not allow penetration by certain beta-lactams. Also when a resistant strain expresses porin OmpK37 is less susceptible to cefotaxime and cefoxitin than when it is expressing either OmpK36 or OmpK35.

MdtC is a transporter that forms a heteromultimer complex with MdtB to form a multidrug transporter. MdtBC is part of the MdtABC-TolC efflux complex. KpnH consists of ~511 residues resembles EmrB of E. coli and is probably a translocase in the KpnGH-TolC efflux protein in K. pneumoniae. Disruption of the pump components KpnG-KpnH signficantly decrease resistance to azithromycin ceftazidime ciprofloxacin ertapenem erythromycin gentamicin imipenem ticarcillin norfloxacin polymyxin-B piperacillin spectinomycin tobramycin and streptomycin.

KpnG consists of ~390 residues and resembles EmrA of E. coli. Disruption of the pump components KpnG-KpnH signficantly decrease resistance to azithromycin ceftazidime ciprofloxacin ertapenem erythromycin gentamicin imipenem ticarcillin norfloxacin polymyxin-B piperacillin spectinomycin tobramycin and streptomycin
EmrR is a negative regulator for the EmrAB-TolC multidrug efflux pump in E. coli. Mutations lead to EmrAB-TolC overexpression.
RND efflux pump conferring resistance to fluoroquinolone
RND efflux pump conferring resistance to fluoroquinolone
MdtB is a transporter that forms a heteromultimer complex with MdtC to form a multidrug transporter. MdtBC is part of the MdtABC-TolC efflux complex.

MdtC is a transporter that forms a heteromultimer complex with MdtB to form a multidrug transporter. MdtBC is part of the MdtABC-TolC efflux complex. In the absence of MdtB MdtC can form a homomultimer complex that results in a functioning efflux complex with a narrower drug specificity. mdtC corresponds to 3 loci in Pseudomonas aeruginosa PAO1 (gene name: muxC/muxB) and 3 loci in Pseudomonas aeruginosa LESB58.
BaeR is a response regulator that promotes the expression of MdtABC and AcrD efflux complexes.
AcrD is an aminoglycoside efflux pump expressed in E. coli. Its expression can be induced by indole and is regulated by baeRS and cpxAR.

Klebsiella pneumoniae outer membrane porin protein. Is preferentially detected in porin-deficient strains. Functional characterization of this new porin revealed a narrower pore than those of porins OmpK35 and OmpK36 which did not allow penetration by certain beta-lactams. Also when a resistant strain expresses porin OmpK37 is less susceptible to cefotaxime and cefoxitin than when it is expressing either OmpK36 or OmpK35.
In the presence of antibiotic stress E. coli overexpresses the global activator protein MarA which besides inducing MDR efflux pump AcrAB also down- regulates synthesis of the porin OmpF.

RamA (resistance antibiotic multiple) is a positive regulator of AcrAB-TolC and leads to high level multidrug resistance in Klebsiella pneumoniae Salmonella enterica and Enterobacter aerugenes increasing the expression of both the mar operon as well as AcrAB. RamA also decreases OmpF expression.
CpxA is a membrane-localized sensor kinase that is activated by envelope stress. It starts a kinase cascade that activates CpxR which promotes efflux complex expression.

MsbA is a multidrug resistance transporter homolog from E. coli and belongs to a superfamily of transporters that contain an adenosine triphosphate (ATP) binding cassette (ABC) which is also called a nucleotide-binding domain (NBD). MsbA is a member of the MDR-ABC transporter group by sequence homology. MsbA transports lipid A a major component of the bacterial outer cell membrane and is the only bacterial ABC transporter that is essential for cell viability.

KpnE subunit of KpnEF resembles EbrAB from E. coli. Mutation in KpnEF resulted in increased susceptibility to cefepime ceftriaxon colistin erythromycin rifampin tetracycline and streptomycin as well as enhanced sensitivity toward sodium dodecyl sulfate deoxycholate dyes benzalkonium chloride chlorhexidine and triclosan

KpnF subunit of KpnEF resembles EbrAB from E. coli. Mutation in KpnEF resulted in increased susceptibility to cefepime ceftriaxon colistin erythromycin rifampin tetracycline and streptomycin as well as enhanced sensitivity toward sodium dodecyl sulfate deoxycholate dyes benzalkonium chloride chlorhexidine and triclosan.

The mphA gene encodes for resistance enzyme MPH(2')-I which preferentially inactivate 14-membered macrolides (e.g.erythromycin telithromycin roxithromycin) over 16-membered macrolides (e.g.tylosin spiramycin). It phosphorylates macrolides at 2'-OH hydroxyl of desosamine sugar of macrolides in a GTP-dependent manner.
Sul1 is a sulfonamide resistant dihydropteroate synthase of Gram-negative bacteria. It is linked to other resistance genes of class 1 integrons.
aadA2 is an aminoglycoside nucleotidyltransferase gene encoded by plasmids and integrons in K. pneumoniae Salmonella spp. Corynebacterium glutamicum C. freundii and Aeromonas spp.
dfrA12 is an integron-encoded dihydrofolate reductase found in Vibrio cholerae
catI is a chromosome and transposon-encoded variant of the cat gene found in Escherichia coli and Acinetobacter baumannii
KPC-2 is a beta-lactamase found in Klebsiella pneumoniae and Pseudomonas aeruginosa.
AcrA is a subunit of the AcrAB multidrug efflux system that in K. pneumoniae which is encoded by the acrRAB operon.

Protein subunit of AcrA-AcrB-TolC multidrug efflux complex. AcrB functions as a herterotrimer which forms the inner membrane component and is primarily responsible for substrate recognition and energy transduction by acting as a drug/proton antiporter.
AAC(6')-Ib10 is an integron-encoded aminoglycoside acetyltransferase in P. aeruginosa
TEM-122 is an inhibitor-resistant beta-lactamase found in E. coli.
fosA6 is a plasmid-encoded enzyme that confers resistance to fosfomycin in Escherichia coli by breaking the epoxide ring of the molecule.
OXA-9 is a beta-lactamase found in Klebsiella pneumoniae.

H-NS is a histone-like protein involved in global gene regulation in Gram-negative bacteria. It is a repressor of the membrane fusion protein genes acrE mdtE and emrK as well as nearby genes of many RND-type multidrug exporters.

APH(3')-Ia is a transposon-encoded aminoglycoside phosphotransferase in E. coli and S. enterica. It is identical at the protein sequence to APH(3')-Ic an aminoglycoside phosphotransferase encoded by plasmids transposons and genomic islands in K. pneumoniae A. baumannii S. marcescens Corynebacterium spp. Photobacterium spp. and Citrobacter spp.
CRP is a global regulator that represses MdtEF multidrug efflux pump expression.
